intro: Crepis taraxacifolia subsp. praecox, commonly known as the early crepis, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming basal leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It is an annual or biennial herb that produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Its botanical features make it a common sight in open, sunny habitats across its native range.
